com.eyeq.pivot4j.transform

Interface PlaceLevelsOnAxes

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Transform
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlaceLevelsOnAxesImpl

    public interface PlaceLevelsOnAxes
extends Transform
    Allows to place levels on the visible query axes.

    Use Case.

    • The GUI will examine the result of the olap query to find out which levels are currently displayed on what axes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLevel(Axis axis, Level level, int position) 
      List<Level> findVisibleLevels(Axis axis)
      Collects all levels on a given axis in the result.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.eyeq.pivot4j.transform.Transform

        getModel

    • Method Detail

      • placeLevels

        void placeLevels(Axis axis,
               List<Level> levels)
        Parameters:
        axis - The target axis
        levels - The levels to put

      • addLevel

        void addLevel(Axis axis,
            Level level,
            int position)
        Parameters:
        axis - The target axis
        level - The level to add
        position - The position index where to add the level. Any value less than zero will put the hierarchy at the end of the axis. Note that it's the index of the parent hierarchy, not the level itself since the order of a level in a hierarchy cannot be changed by definition. If the parent hierarchy exists on any axis, the position argument will be ignored.

      • removeLevel

        void removeLevel(Axis axis,
               Level level)
        Parameters:
        axis - The target axis
        level - The level to remove

      • findVisibleLevels

        List<Level> findVisibleLevels(Axis axis)
        Collects all levels on a given axis in the result. If no levels are visible, it returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis to use
        Returns:
        A list of levels

      • findVisibleLevels

        List<Level> findVisibleLevels(Hierarchy hierarchy)
        Collects all levels on a given hierarchy in the result. If no levels are visible, it returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        hierarchy - the hierarchy to use
        Returns:
        A list of levels
